email_chain.subject: Rice Shipment from Yawata to Benin - June Laycan
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Santos,

We have a shipment of rice from Yawata, Japan to Benin that needs your attention. Are you available to confirm a June laycan? And can you advise me on the cost, given the short lead time?

Yours,
April

email_chain.subject: Re: Rice Shipment from Yawata to Benin - June Laycan
email_chain.body:
Thanks for your note of May 14.

We've just confirmed a June 25 departure for Benin. The shipping company has told us the cost for ocean freight, U.S. port to Japanese port, customs clearance in Benin, and trucking the rice to the Beninese port, as agreed. We've made all necessary payments and will send you a bill soon.

Are you planning to import rice on behalf of your client? Or are you going to ship it from your own warehouse in Benin?

Regards,
April

email_chain.subject: Re: Rice Shipment from Yawata to Benin - June Laycan
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your message of May 19.

We're going to import the rice on our own behalf, as we do most of our food imports. We'll buy a few trucks for transportation to the port from the best Beninese sources we can find. We'll also take care of clearance at the port and of any potential legal issues, as we do. Is that enough information for you?

Regards,
April

email_chain.subject: Re: Rice Shipment from Yawata to Benin - June Laycan
email_chain.body:
Glad to hear that.

We've made an advance payment to your company for the rice shipment. Could you check with the shipping company about the precise routing of the shipment?

Sincerely,
T. Watkins

email_chain.subject: Re: Rice Shipment from Yawata to Benin - June Laycan
email_chain.body:
Dear Watkins,

Thanks for the message. The shipment of rice has now departed Yawata for Manila. It will take 4-6 weeks from Manila to Benin. No delays anticipated. I have advised our supplier of the change.

Yours,
Matsuo

email_chain.subject: Urgent: 5000MT Soybean Shipment Ningbo-Zeebrugge

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: 5000MT Soybean Shipment Ningbo-Zeebrugge
email_chain.body:

We have made space on our 1999 built 48,000 DWT clean diesel carrier, to call from Ningbo on November 20, then running directly to Zeebrugge. It's the fastest sail from Ningbo to Zeebrugge – 16 days! I have room for 4,400MT at the following rates:

ROROTRANSFER: $1.00/FT + $4.00/MT DISCHARGE CHARGE
Boarding & stow: $0.00/FT + $0.00/MT
Gross Toll: $25.00/FT + $1.00/MT
NAVFAC Tolls: $30.00/FT

Best regards,
Carlos Bravo

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: 5000MT Soybean Shipment Ningbo-Zeebrugge
email_chain.body:
Dear Desmond,

I have just received additional information and can offer you an alternative quote using the Shiraichi shipping line at the following rates:

Boarding & stow: $0.00/FT + $0.00/MT
CARGO TOLL: $0.00/FT + $0.00/MT
NAVFAC Tolls: $0.00/FT + $0.00/MT
CHARTER FEE: $8.00/FT + $0.00/MT
TRAMP CHARGES: $0.00/FT + $0.00/MT

Please let me know if you would like to proceed with either option.

Best regards,
Carlos Bravo

email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Rate Quote Follow-up Questions
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Kim,

Thank you for your quote. Before proceeding, I need clarification on several points:

1. What is the service speed on the route?
2. What are the cruising conditions?
3. What are your consumption fees? (e.g., Diesel, Fresh Water per MT)
4. Are there any berthing charges?
5. Does your price include all charges, specifically:
   - Port dues and anchorage fees
   - Any additional operational costs

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Re: August-September Rate Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Kim,

Regarding your vessel's availability in August and September for the 5,200MT route between Singapore and South Korea, could you provide comprehensive rate quotes including:

A) Bunker fuel consumption, crew wages, and related costs
B) Port charges, mooring costs, and port operation expenses
C) Crew wages and miscellaneous fees
D) Any other applicable costs

We're interested in August commitment with possible September extension.

Best regards,
Kate

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Breakout Analysis
email_chain.body:
Good morning Chichi,

It looks like the NBP (Net Breakout Position) is breaking out to the upside. Is this a genuine bullish move?

If so, we must consider increasing our exposure to crude options from the low 40s to the 70s.

Regards,
Jackie

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Breakout Analysis
email_chain.body:
Hi Jackie,

I would love to take credit for the move in crude. However, this is primarily event-driven.

After the Q4 2013 outlook call, crude oil finished strong but the 42.5 handle didn't sustain. Looking at the bigger picture, crude is confirming our trading zone of 40-46.

There are additional market factors at play that I'll elaborate on in my next analysis.

Stay tuned!

Chichi

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Breakout Analysis
email_chain.body:
Good morning Chichi,

With the 50 EMA just about to hit the 42.5 handle, would this be a good time to place the cut-loss order?

Regards,
Jackie

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Breakout Analysis
email_chain.body:
Jackie,

Here's the breakout scenario:

- At 38.5 handle, crude was in a trading zone
- At 40, it closed above 38.5 handle (outside trading range)
- We came in at 40.2 on the 7/23 call, triggering the highest swing up since 7/2 (42.5)
- At 42.5, we enter an overbought zone (up-trending market)

A stop is not necessary because our exit (42.5) is extremely protective.

Best,
Chichi

email_chain.subject: Aviation Fuel Shipment Inquiry - Houston to Amsterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Smythe,

Could you advise your next open laycan for moving 5,200MT of refined aviation fuel from Houston to Amsterdam in late September? You may choose FOB or CIF. Do you accept lumpsum deals?

Kind regards,
Mr. Bravo

email_chain.subject: Re: Aviation Fuel Shipment Inquiry - Houston to Amsterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bravo,

Yes, thank you for your message. We will be in Hamburg starting the second week of September, so we will be able to perform a CIF transfer there, provided you would also like to do the same.

Regards,
Mrs. Smythe

email_chain.subject: Re: Aviation Fuel Shipment Inquiry - Houston to Amsterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Smythe,

The transfer has been completed. I should inform you that the customer has overpaid.

Regards,
Mr. Bravo

email_chain.subject: Re: Aviation Fuel Shipment Inquiry - Houston to Amsterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bravo,

You are correct about the overpayment. You should handle this situation appropriately by discussing with the customer about returning a portion of the overpaid amount. Please remember that any profit made in this situation must be accounted for as per our legal agreement.

Regards,
Mrs. Smythe

email_chain.subject: Re: Aviation Fuel Shipment Inquiry - Houston to Amsterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Smythe,

Thank you for your message. I have initiated discussion with the customer and await their final response. I have forwarded the documentation they provided as requested. Would you please review and provide any feedback on these additional documents?

Regards,
Mr. Bravo

email_chain.subject: Re: Aviation Fuel Shipment Inquiry - Houston to Amsterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bravo,

The documents look fine to me, but there are two things you have to do:

1. Find another mode of transport for the remaining 1,200 MT of aviation fuel, which the customer won't take back. You can make a lot of money with this volume, as this aviation fuel is due to be consumed on the day you will receive it in Amsterdam. The customer does not want to transport the 1,200 MT to Belgium, so you should sell this additional aviation fuel on a spot basis and ensure proper credit risk management.

2. Sell your FOB Hamburg cargo to the customer for a lump sum to secure full value.

Please use the additional document we discussed to cover all risks.

Regards,
Mrs. Smythe

email_chain.body:

Mark

email_chain.subject: Bill of Lading Amendment Request - Port Harcourt to Benin

Best regards,
Emmet

email_chain.subject: Re: Bill of Lading Amendment Request - Port Harcourt to Benin
email_chain.body:

On behalf of our client, we regret to advise that there are some incorrect declarations on the booking from Port Harcourt to Benin, and thus the entry of the container in this booking is prohibited. The corrected declaration must be sent to us for approval before the booking can be re-registered.

Please advise.

Kindly,
Ciaran

email_chain.subject: Re: Bill of Lading Amendment Request - Port Harcourt to Benin
email_chain.body:
Hello Emmet,

Unfortunately, we cannot accommodate the amendments requested for the booking from Port Harcourt to Benin, as this booking is being intercepted on behalf of our client. As we cannot approve these changes, the booking must be dropped.

Kindly,
Ciaran

You have my apologies for having to contact you on such an important matter, but my boss was called away for a sudden family emergency, and I had to fill in for him.

We are looking to hire a project manager for a 400km long network of seawall repairs on the long island coast of Indonesia. We need you to prepare a proposal with all the necessary technical specifications. It is of course a highly secretive and secure project that requires the highest possible integrity, so we need you to make sure that no one in your organisation knows about this, or we will not accept the proposal.

This project will be conducted by a consortium of foreign experts and we are asking you to contribute with your expertise on seawalls.

Best regards

email_chain.subject: Re: Confidential: Indonesia Seawall Project - Project Manager Position
email_chain.body:
Thank you for contacting us!

It is a pleasure to be able to meet your company's needs with our years of experience in the Indian market. Our Proposal includes highly experienced individuals that are well versed with the protocol and demands of the Indian Government, which makes us the clear choice for this position.

We look forward to working with you on this project!

Kinan & Keshab
One Universe Global Plc.

email_chain.subject: Schedule Check Request - 6000dwt Bremerhaven to Shanghai

email_chain.subject: Re: Schedule Check Request - 6000dwt Bremerhaven to Shanghai
email_chain.body:
Bonjour,

After a phone call with shipowners, we have scheduled for your client the positioning to Bremerhaven on February 6th and departure on February 16th, 2016. The ship will be loading from Berth C at Bremerhaven.

Port calls will be:
- Baogang: February 26th
- Dayi: February 27th
- Shanghai: February 28th

The expected load port will be Jinqiao on March 8th. Please find the itinerary attached.

Best regards

email_chain.subject: Container Booking Guidelines - Jinqiao Terminal
email_chain.body:
Bonjour,

Please note the following container booking guidelines:

1. Commercial Transshipment Requirements:
- SGM cargo delivery must align with terminal arrival dates
- Booking changes must be requested before commercial transshipment starts
- Door-to-door service arrangements must be confirmed in advance

2. Terminal Restrictions:
- Jinqiao Mahul Terminal does not accept containers from Zone 2
- First container release in 45 days after loading completion
- Remaining containers release in 50 days
- Containers must be released from original storage area

Best regards

email_chain.subject: Container Technical Requirements
email_chain.body:
Additional technical specifications:

- No weight limitations on 40' and 20' containers
- Maximum blockage allowance: 2.5cm from center line
- Wooden blocks must not be exposed or in contact with tarpaulins
- One Vortex vent required per 20' container for each pallet row

Best regards

email_chain.subject: Additional Terminal Regulations
email_chain.body:
Important terminal regulations:

- Precise container placement requirements must be followed
- No chemical loading without Shipping Company authorization
- No RORO ramp crossing between terminals
- Hazardous substances prohibited in Jinqiao
- Special handling procedures for containers under 20' from China

Best regards

email_chain.body:

Best regards,
James

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: Container Booking Rotterdam-Halifax
email_chain.body:

For the empty return from Halifax to Rotterdam, we have several options:

1. COD Rotterdam, tomorrow Thursday 31st
2. Container via Hamburg to Rotterdam, Friday 1st February
3. Direct ZIM service arriving Rotterdam on the 2nd (container needs to be at terminal by Thursday 4 PM)

Please let me know your preference.

Best regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Heavy Gasoline Shipment from Cartagena - Quote Request

email_chain.subject: Re: Heavy Gasoline Shipment from Cartagena - Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Dan,

Regarding your shipment inquiry, I'm happy to discuss your logistics needs. There are some current challenges including weather impact and Suez Canal bottlenecks affecting transportation. The earliest available vessel for loading would be in 14 days.

We can expedite shipping with our fastest available vessel for a 7% premium to cover additional risks and uncertainty. I'm attaching indicative transport costs including port dues for your review. These figures may adjust based on final contract details.

Kind regards,
Simon

email_chain.body:
Dear Simon,

Thank you for your prompt response. I will confirm the exact volumes by end of day. Our usual weekly schedule is for January 27th.

Please note this cargo is classified as an LPG product and is subject to a 2% surcharge due to the very high shipping cost.

I look forward to receiving the final quote today.

Thanks,
Dan

email_chain.subject: Re: Heavy Gasoline Shipment from Cartagena - Quote Request
email_chain.body:

We've requested an additional 1,000 tons of cargo capacity as we have another customer requiring this space on the same vessel.

Kind regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Sugar Shipment Cost Calculation - Santos to Libreville
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Santiago,

Your demurrage invoice for 8,000MT of sugar from Santos to Libreville has been calculated based on the following factors:

Bulk Carbon Rate: $0.14/Metric Ton
DP Charge: $4,700
Demurrage: $3,100
Total Due: $8,014.80

For your consideration, an alternative scenario of 8,000MT at $0.12/Metric Ton would result in:

Bulk Carbon Rate: $0.14/Metric Ton
DP Charge: $4,700
Demurrage: $0.75/Metric Ton
Total Due: $8,014.80

Recommendation: Please consider using a 9,000MT bill of lading for optimal pricing.

Best regards

email_chain.subject: Case 21-20326: 3DAYLY LLC Bankruptcy Filing
email_chain.body:
Notice of Bankruptcy Filing

On April 27, 2021, 3DAYLY LLC and its related entities and affiliates ('Debtors') filed voluntary petitions for relief under Chapter 11 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code in the United States Bankruptcy Court for the Southern District of New York.

The Debtors operate a worldwide customer delivery company across five industries: transportation (trucking), e-commerce (last mile delivery), financial technology (crypto-currency payments), hospitality and transportation (chauffeur services). The company maintains a fleet of 800,000 vehicles and is headquartered in Stamford, Connecticut with operations throughout North America.

email_chain.subject: Job Application Guidelines
email_chain.body:
Dear Candidate,

As you prepare to apply for positions within our company, we wanted to provide some important guidelines about professional communication.

When writing your application emails, consider your tone carefully. While you want to show enthusiasm, maintaining professionalism is crucial. Consider how someone you admire in the industry would communicate, and use that as a model for your own correspondence.

Best regards,
HR Team

email_chain.subject: RE: Job Application Guidelines - Proper Addressing
email_chain.body:
Important note regarding addressing hiring managers:

When addressing your application emails, please use the following format:
- Preferred: 'Dear Mr. Goldie' or 'Dear Mr. Ron Goldie'
- Avoid using generic 'Dear Sir/Madam' when possible

If you're uncertain about the recipient's name or title, please contact HR for clarification.

Best regards,
HR Team

email_chain.subject: RE: Job Application Guidelines - Communication Methods
email_chain.body:
Regarding communication methods:

For job applications and initial correspondence, email is the preferred method of communication. This ensures prompt response and efficient processing of your application.

Letters are more appropriate for formal documentation that may follow later in the process.

Best regards,
HR Team

email_chain.subject: RE: Job Application Guidelines - Example of Poor Communication
email_chain.body:
Here's an example of what to avoid in your communications:

Dear Mr. Goldie,
I would like to inform you that a final decision has been made about the hiring process and I need to come to London to continue the recruitment process on the 12th of November. I will be leaving Paris on the 11th at 1 pm. I will be going by train and I will reach Paris Nord at 6.30. I would be very grateful if you could arrange a car and driver to collect me.

This example is too informal and makes assumptions about travel arrangements. Always maintain professionalism and discuss logistics only after they've been formally offered.

Best regards,
HR Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Cargo Inquiry - Jubail to Salalah

Matthieu

email_chain.subject: Bond Papers Status
email_chain.body:
Good day sir,

Regarding the bond papers, John has informed me that these must be signed by his superior before we can forward them to you. We will arrange for express delivery once signed. Please confirm your delivery address so we can ensure timely delivery.

Thank you for your continued business relationship with us.

Sincerely yours,
Daniel James

email_chain.subject: Investment Opportunity in Dry Bulk Shipping
email_chain.body:
Hi M. Corbin,

I hope this email finds you well. I'm reaching out regarding potential investment opportunities in the dry bulk shipping sector. We've begun our selection process for new investors and would value your participation.

Would you be interested in exploring investment options in this space?

Best regards,
Vladimir

email_chain.subject: Re: Investment Opportunity in Dry Bulk Shipping
email_chain.body:
Dear M. Corbin,

Following up on Vladimir's email, I wanted to provide more context about the Singapore-centered dry bulk finance market. We're seeing significant capital inflow from banks and investment firms into this sector.

The key question is whether this increased volume of shipping loans will enhance returns and meaningfully impact sector financing. I'd be happy to discuss both the potential pitfalls and opportunities in more detail.

Best regards,
Anatoliy

email_chain.subject: Re: Investment Opportunity in Dry Bulk Shipping
email_chain.body:
Dear M. Corbin,

I wanted to elaborate on the current market conditions. While the dry bulk finance market is experiencing growth due to the low interest rate environment, there are important factors to consider:

- Low interest rates are impacting profit margins
- Decreasing commodity demand affects vessel utilization
- Cost efficiency is becoming crucial for profitability

Would you like to schedule a call to discuss these points in more detail?

Best regards,
Vladimir

email_chain.subject: RE: Quote Request on CO2/C2/15

email_chain.subject: RE: Quote Request on CO2/C2/15
email_chain.body:

1. What is the daily rate?

Gary

email_chain.subject: Help with email timestamp parsing
email_chain.body:
I'm dealing with email logs that have multiple entries with the same timestamp. Need to ensure we only pick the first occurrence when parsing. Here's what the data looks like:

Email 1: [timestamp]
Email B 1: [same timestamp]
Email 2: [different timestamp]

What would be the best way to handle this?

email_chain.subject: Re: Help with email timestamp parsing
email_chain.body: Are you using Python for this? If so, you could store processed timestamps in a set and check against it before processing each email. This way you'll only process the first occurrence of each timestamp.

email_chain.subject: Re: Help with email timestamp parsing
email_chain.body:
Yes, I'm using Python. Currently trying something like this:

import re
regex_date = r"\[.+\]"

But I feel there might be an easier way. I have hundreds of emails to process. Would you recommend using regex to find the first email with each date?

Hi Helena,

I plan to move 200MT of wheat from Constanza to Calais. Could you specify if there will be any dock delays, and do you offer in-depot storage?

With regards,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment Query - Constanza to Calais
email_chain.body:
Hi Andrew,

With the usual 5 days at Constanza, there will be no major issues at Calais. We are extending a 7-day storage option at our Med terminal to reduce the current backlog.

With regards,
Helena

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment Query - Constanza to Calais
email_chain.body:
Hi Helena,

Thank you for the update. Is the storage part of the service?

With regards,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment Query - Constanza to Calais
email_chain.body:
Hi Andrew,

As usual, the storage charge is applied to the line fee from the warehouse.

Regards,
Helena

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment Query - Constanza to Calais
email_chain.body:
Hi Helena,

OK, thank you very much.

Regards,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Order Documents and Payment Terms
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Abubakar Al-Abdu

email_chain.body:
Hi Abubakar,

Best regards,
Luke

email_chain.subject: Re: Order Documents and Payment Terms
email_chain.body:
Hi Abubakar,

Thanks for the call. I was out of office yesterday and so was unable to reply to your email.

However, I will send you the payment terms documents this afternoon.

Best regards,
Luke

email_chain.subject: Re: Order Documents and Payment Terms
email_chain.body:
Hi Luke,

I could not reach you yesterday, however I will forward you the payment terms document at once.

I would prefer the full payment, but if that is not an option, we could also opt for installment payment plan.

I would be glad to have your expert advice on this.

Best regards,
Abubakar Al-Abdu

email_chain.subject: Re: Order Documents and Payment Terms
email_chain.body:
Hi Abubakar,

Thank you for the emails.

We can do full payment or installment payment plan.

We will send the payment terms documents for you to review.

Regards,
Luke

email_chain.subject: Re: Order Documents and Payment Terms
email_chain.body:
Hi Luke,

I prefer the installment payment plan. I could receive 5% of the total contract amount as first installment.

Additionally, I could send you the payment schedule after you forward me the contract documents.

The total contract amount for this project is 25,000,000,000 (twenty five billion naira).

Best regards,
Abubakar Al-Abdu

email_chain.subject: Container Shipment Inquiry - Singapore to Zaragoza
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Kim,

Would you consider a 5,000mt voyage of 20-ft. ISO containers loaded with electronics, toys, and arts from Singapore to Zaragoza?

Looking forward to hearing from you,

Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Container Shipment Inquiry - Singapore to Zaragoza
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

Thanks for your email. We are happy to transport your commodities via sea-freight. Please kindly provide your shipment details.

Sincerely,
Stella

email_chain.subject: Re: Container Shipment Inquiry - Singapore to Zaragoza
email_chain.body:
Dear Stella,

Thank you for your swift response. I am sending you the shipment details of our commodities in the attachment.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Container Shipment Inquiry - Singapore to Zaragoza
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

I have reviewed your email and attachment. It sounds good to us. Do you have the Certificate of Origin (CoO)?

We will ship your commodities to Spain on 12 August.

Have a good day.

Stella

email_chain.subject: Re: Container Shipment Inquiry - Singapore to Zaragoza
email_chain.body:
Dear Stella,

Thank you for your email. Can you please confirm that you will get back to me regarding the CoO ASAP?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Container Shipment Inquiry - Singapore to Zaragoza
email_chain.body:
Hi Stella,

I just sent you the CoO for the exports from Singapore to Spain. I also want to know if it will be possible for you to transport the following commodities:

- Consumer Goods
- Toys
- Electronics
- Industrial Components
- Metal Products
- Fabricated Metals
- Automotive Parts
- Ores
- Agriculture Products

Please advise at your earliest convenience.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Container Shipment Inquiry - Singapore to Zaragoza
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

We received your email and certificate of origin. However, we cannot ship your commodities to Spain. As you know, the US and the EU are not currently in a free trade agreement (FTA).

Best regards,
Stella

labels.commodity: electronics, toys, arts, consumer goods, industrial components, metal products, automotive parts, ores, agriculture products

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Process Efficiency Discussion
email_chain.body:
Hi Maria,

Thank you for your response regarding the milk powder shipment. I'm currently working on a report about improving our shipping process efficiency. I understand that Yazaki uses email for order and scheduling inquiries, but I've heard that some competitors like Yasakawa have different approaches. Would you be willing to discuss this in more detail? Your insights would be very valuable for my research.

Best regards,
Evie

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Collaboration Discussion
email_chain.body:
Hello Maria,

I recently had a conversation with Yousef, Yazaki's owner, about a potential collaboration. He expressed interest in learning more about our shipping processes, and I shared some research about recent changes in booking procedures. I would appreciate your guidance on how we might best move forward with this discussion.

email_chain.subject: Weekend Loading Query - Victoria to Portland Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:

Warmly,
Helena

email_chain.subject: Re: Weekend Loading Query - Victoria to Portland Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Helena,

Thank you for your inquiry. For the upcoming shipments, we have arranged vessel scheduling as follows:

Lane 1 will be operational Monday-Friday with WL5 assigned for Thursday and Friday.
WL7 is scheduled Friday through Monday.
WL5 and WL6 will operate Monday and Tuesday.
WL6 will handle Wednesday and Thursday operations.

This arrangement ensures both lanes remain fully operational. Weekend loading does include a 15% premium.

Best regards,
Lucia

email_chain.subject: Re: Invoice Update - Portland Terminal
email_chain.body:
Hi Lucia,

I've updated our invoice to reflect [Portland OR Inbound] and [Terminal Docking Bay] designations as requested.

Kind regards,
Cheryl

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment Booking - Shanghai to Vancouver
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

That'll be fine. The Venus is indeed ideal for your sugar cargo. She will sail from Shanghai on 6 February and arrive in Vancouver on 12 February. The Venus is a high-volume, reliable vessel, and I don't anticipate any delays.

You can send the invoices directly to me, and I'll handle the necessary paperwork.

Best regards,
Mary Perkins

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment Booking - Shanghai to Vancouver
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Perkins,

Thank you for confirming. I'll forward the relevant invoices once everything is finalized.

Regards,
Kelly

email_chain.subject: Re: Brake Fluid Cargo Inquiry - Port Said to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Hi Kelly,

Thanks for reaching out. Our turnaround time for this route is typically around 4-5 days. Our service schedule runs twice weekly, but we can accommodate adjustments if needed.

I've attached our latest price list for your reference.

Kind regards,
Bobby

email_chain.subject: Re: Brake Fluid Cargo Inquiry - Port Said to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Bobby,

Thank you for the prompt response. Our vessel will be arriving on 15 April, and we are looking for a prompt shipment. Is it possible to expedite the turnaround time? We have a pressing deadline, and every day counts.

Please also let me know if there are any additional charges that we need to consider.

Thanks again,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Brake Fluid Cargo Inquiry - Port Said to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Hello John,

Yes, we can expedite the turnaround time for your shipment. We'll arrange for priority loading and transport to ensure shorter handling time. All customs and logistics processes will be expedited, though additional charges will apply for these premium services.

Please let me know if you need any further information.

Best regards,
Janelle

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry - Shanghai to Sri Lanka Shipment
email_chain.body:
Simon,

Could you please suggest a vessel to transport 4,000MT of cargo from Shanghai to Sri Lanka? Please let me know if your vessel can sail at the beginning of May, or would you prefer mid-June?

Best regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Shanghai to Sri Lanka Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mike,

Our vessel operates at 11-12 knots and is a fully containerized ship. Currently, she's running at 60% capacity (maximum capacity 5,000 MT). The vessel will call at Hong Kong on June 1st and arrive in Sri Lanka early morning on June 9th.

Please let me know if you would like to proceed with these arrangements.

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Shanghai to Sri Lanka Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Simon,

I agree with the proposed solution. Your schedule works for us.

Best regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Shanghai to Sri Lanka Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mike,

Please provide the following details as soon as possible:

1. Confirmation of vessel arrival in Sri Lanka mid-June
2. Specific arrival time requirements
3. Whether you need additional port details or vessel information

Your prompt response will help me provide suitable solutions.

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry - Shanghai to Sri Lanka Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mike,

Thank you for this opportunity. However, I need more specific details to proceed. Given the time-sensitive nature of shipping arrangements, I can only hold this option for 48 hours.

Please provide complete information about your containerized cargo requirements at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Canada-NZ Cruise Booking - Initial Questionnaire

Melinda

email_chain.subject: RE: Canada-NZ Cruise Booking - Itinerary and Forms
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: RE: Canada-NZ Cruise Booking - Follow-up
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. and Mrs. Kelly,

I hope this email finds you well. I was just wondering whether you received the booking form, along with the itinerary and other documents that were sent to you in the last email. If you have not received them please let me know and I will resend them immediately.

All the best,
Melinda

email_chain.subject: RE: Canada-NZ Cruise Booking - Questionnaire Received
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. and Mrs. Kelly,

We are so sorry for the delay in replying to your email. There seems to have been an issue with our email server which meant we did not receive your questionnaires. We have now received them and we will be in touch with you shortly.

Many thanks,
Melinda

email_chain.body:

I'm looking to move a cargo of oranges from Shanghai to Leixoes and want to know if you can provide me a reliable sea freight quote for this. Can I expect a same-day reply?

Thanks,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Re: Sea Freight Quote Request - Shanghai to Leixoes
email_chain.body:
Dear Chris,

We're sorry but we are not able to provide a reliable sea freight quote as we do not handle such shipments.

Best regards,
Rachel

email_chain.subject: Cargo Status - Greek Customs Clearance
email_chain.body:
Hi Rob,

Just wanted to check in regarding our last communication. I understand there have been some issues getting that cargo through Greek Customs. Could you please explain the situation to me and give me your plans to deliver the product to Broker Inc?

Thank you!
Max

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Status - Greek Customs Clearance
email_chain.body:
Hi Rob,

Since our last communication, the shipping container was unloaded in Thessaloniki, Greece. It has been at the port for the last three weeks trying to be cleared through Customs. I have been in touch with my local representative on a daily basis to see if the product can be cleared. For now, there is no update. I am worried that our clients are going to be concerned about the delay.

Could you please provide me with an estimated timeline so we can let my client know if and when the product can be released?

Thank you!
Max

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Status - Greek Customs Clearance
email_chain.body:
Hi Max,

Thanks for the update. I've been in touch with the local representative in Greece. The container has been at the port for two weeks now. There is a lot of back and forth between the shipper, the shipper's agent in Greece, and the local Customs agent. The shipper has had to pay several fines to Greek Customs.

Currently, the container is at the port in Thessaloniki, waiting for the shipper to send a new bill of lading. Once the bill of lading is sent, the container will be cleared and sent to Broker Inc.

I've attached a couple of photos to give you an idea of the situation. As soon as the bill of lading is approved, I'll let you know and send you more photos of the process.

Best regards,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Status - Greek Customs Clearance
email_chain.body:
Hi Max,

I've attached a photo of the container clearing through Greek Customs. Once I receive the bill of lading, I will send you the next pictures of the container as it is being loaded onto a transport truck. We hope to have the container at the shipper's warehouse within two weeks.

Best regards,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Status - Greek Customs Clearance
email_chain.body:
Hi Max,

The container is finally at the shipper's warehouse in California. Unfortunately, there are still problems with it getting to the shipping agent in San Francisco. The forwarding agent tried to take it there but was told by the freight broker that it had already been invoiced to them. The forwarding agent has been advised to contact the broker directly to resolve this issue.

Best regards,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote Confirmation - Tank Delivery
email_chain.body:
The shipping schedule and tank size is different from your previous quote. Could you confirm if this is acceptable for both?

Thanks,
Leanne

Please note that I want the following quote to be processed as a new job:

Tank size: 40K
45 tonne/hectolitre - HPMC precast pile driving concrete
No. of tanks: 1
Destination: Australia/VIC/Stony Creek
Address: 159 Stony Creek Rd, Stony Creek VIC 3971

email_chain.subject: Cargo Inquiry - Concrete Blocks Denmark to Zurich
email_chain.body:
Good morning,

I'm writing to you on behalf of a dear friend and colleague Mr. Rudolf Acers from Frankfurt. My colleague has been tasked to help arrange for the shipment of an unusual cargo – 30 x 2″ square concrete blocks from Denmark to Zurich.

Can you confirm whether you can handle this cargo, and what the minimum booking quantities might be?

I thank you for your time,

Ian

Blue Oar Maritime Limited
Phone: +41 100 000 000

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry - Concrete Blocks Denmark to Zurich
email_chain.body:
Dear Ian,

Thank you for your email regarding the concrete blocks shipment.

Kindly be informed that Blue Oar Maritime Ltd. can handle the cargo for you. The minimum quantity we can handle is 1 block.

Please advise when your friend can proceed with the booking and the estimated delivery dates to Zurich.

If you have any questions, kindly do not hesitate to contact us.

Best regards,
Blue Oar Maritime Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry - Concrete Blocks Denmark to Zurich
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

Thank you for your response to my colleague's query.

I'd be grateful if you could advise on the following:
1. If the blocks are packed in their own crates or in a common crate?
2. How many crates per shipment can be handled?

We appreciate your cooperation on this matter.

Best regards,
Mr. Acers

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry - Concrete Blocks Denmark to Zurich
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Acers,

Regarding your questions:

1. The blocks will be packed in their own crates. There will be 30 x 2″ square concrete blocks per crate.
2. Blue Oar Maritime Ltd. can handle 30 crates per shipment.

We are preparing a detailed quotation for your review. This will be sent separately with our reference number RFRHBRK4787.

Best regards,
Blue Oar Maritime Ltd.
